title: Ticket #4264: Investigate random offsets to update intervals
description:
Any fixed update interval has a bad habit of synchronizing across a distributed system (for example, if the entire cluster is started near-simultaneously or if TCP updates are used and there's a network glitch).

We should review the use and implementation of *_UPDATE_INTERVAL and implement a small amount of random drift to prevent updates from synchronizing.
